Wyll_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Wyll and the Avatar in Act 1.

Laezel_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Lae'zel and the Avatar in Act 3.

Laezel_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Lae'zel and the Avatar in Act 2.

Laezel_BlushingMermaid.synopsis: Astarion and Laezel discuss Blushing Mermaid

Shadowheart_Goblins.synopsis: Astarion comments on how wretched goblins are. Shadow Heart makes a comment about the pot calling the kettle black.

Gale_Monastery.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the monastery

Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette.synopsis: Astarion and Wyll discuss Moonrise Oubliette

Shadowheart_Laezel.synopsis: Astarion prods Shadow Heart over her antagonistic realationship with Lae'Zel. Wants to understand what's at the root of that, but Shadowheart isn't revealing anything.

Laezel_Sunlight.synopsis: While somewhere underground and dark, Astarion complains that he'd rather be back in the sunlight. Lae'zel responds, admonishing him for not going wherever they need to go. Party may or may not know that he's a vampire.

Laezel_BhaalTemple.synopsis: Astarion and Laezel discuss Bhaal Temple

Karlach_HagSwamp.synopsis: Astarion and Karlach chat while wandering FOR

Gale_GeneralSewers.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the General Sewers.

Jaheira_OskarsBeloved.synopsis: Astarion and Jaheira discuss the area where Jaheira lives (or something like that).

Gale_Shadowheart_Love.synopsis: Astarion asks Gale and Shadowheart if they have loves waiting for them on the other side of this. Gale obfuscates. Shadowheart responds.

Karlach_MountainPass.synopsis: Astarion and Karlach discuss the mountain pass

Shadowheart_Temple.synopsis: Astarion comments on the nice, homey feel of the Shar temple. Shadow Heart responds.

Karlach_BaldursMouth.synopsis: Astarion and Karlach discuss Elfsong / Baldur's Mouth

Minthara_ThormMausoleum.synopsis: Minthara and Astarion enter the Thom mausoleum. Astarion admires the surroundings. Minthara chides him.

Karlach_Forest.synopsis: Astarion and Karlach chat while wandering FOR

Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected.synopsis: Astarion and Shadowheart discuss Last Light (protected).

Wyll_Forest.synopsis: This dialogue is about BLIGHTED VILLAGE, not FOR

Minthara_WyrmsRock.synopsis: Minthara and Astarion enter a dungeon beneath Baldur's Gate.

Laezel_ROM_Act1.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Lae'zel and the Avatar in Act 1.

Laezel_Moonrise_Docs.synopsis: Astarion and Laezel discuss Moonrise Docs

Gale_Bomb.synopsis: Astarion wonders what happens to the orb once it's removed. He has some scores he'd like to settle.

Minthara_Bonecloaks.synopsis: Minthara and Astarion banter after entering a home that reminds them of the Underdark

Gale_Moonrise_General.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the Moonrise General.

Gale_Flirt.synopsis: Astarion tries to flirt with Gale. Gale reacts.

Wyll_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Wyll and the Avatar in Act 2.

Wyll_BloomridgePark.synopsis: Astarion and Wyll discuss Bloomridge Park

Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing.synopsis: Astarion and Shadowheart discuss House of Healing.

Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the Moonrise Bridge.

Gale_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Astarion tries to goad some details about sleeping with the goddess Mystra from Gale

Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the Tadpoling Centre in Colony.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune.synopsis: Banter between SH and Astarion. SH has abandoned Shar and is romantically linked to the player

Laezel_SharTemple.synopsis: Astarion and Laezel discuss Shar Temple

Wyll_RoadToSCL.synopsis: Banter between AStarion and Wyll heading toward SCL

Gale_Colony_Generall.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the Colony General.

Laezel_ReithwinVillage.synopsis: Astarion and Laezel discuss Reithwin Village.

Gale_Illusion.synopsis: Astarion and Gale have seen the Hag's illusion disappear, revealing that the sweet forest they were walking through was actually a disgusting swamp. Astarion needles Gale, asking if he can do magic tricks like that.

Jaheira_BaldursGate.synopsis: Astarion and Jaheira discuss Baldur's Gate / Figaro

Wyll_Underdark.synopsis: Astarion asks Wyll if he's much experience with the Underdark. Wyll answers.

Gale_RebelHideout.synopsis: Astarion and Gale discuss the Rebel Hideout beneath the Mason's Guild

Wyll_Gale_Cazador.synopsis: Astarion asks Wyll if he knows the vampire Cazador. Wyll doesn't, but Gale has read about the Szaar coven. Nasty creatures. Astarion quietly agrees.

Shadowheart_SCL_Forest.synopsis: Astarion and Shadowheart discuss Shadow-Cursed lands.

Wyll_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Wyll and the Avatar in Act 3.

Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard.synopsis: Astarion and Karlach discuss Last Light Graveyard

Karlach_ROM_Act2.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Karlach and the Avatar in Act 2.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance.synopsis: Astarion and Shadowheart discuss Guildhall Entrance.

Laezel_Lore.synopsis: Astarion prods Lae'zel, trying to see if she knows of anyone who's ever survived a tadpole. He's disappointed to hear that the two options are death and losing the worm.

Laezel_Combat.synopsis: Astarion compliments Lae'zel on her combat skills, but doesn't understand why she doesn't take more pleasure in killing.

Wyll_Vampire.synopsis: Asks Wyll if he's ever killed a vampire. He might need a hand slaying one later.

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt.synopsis: Astarion tries to flirt with Shadowheart, but is rebuffed. Lae'zel is amused.

Karlach_ROM_Act3.synopsis: Romance Party Banter - Astarion commenting on the relationship between Karlach and the Avatar in Act 3.

Laezel_Rivington_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Rivington_2.text: I used to like this neighbourhood. It was quieter than inside the walls - darker too.

Laezel_Rivington_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Rivington_1.text: Oh, yes - slimmer pickings, but safer targets. The perfect place to learn the craft.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act1_1.text: I hardly saw you at the party. Did the honest and true Blade sneak off for a little fun?

Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act1_0.text: No! Nothing like that at all.

Wyll_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act1_2.text: Oh, but you protest too much. Now I know you were practicing your swordplay.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_3.text: Hey. What's on your mind, Astarion? You seemed a million miles away just then.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_0.text: Hmm? Oh, I was just pondering that heart of yours.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_1.text: There were times I would've been thrilled if everyone who put their hands on me burst into flames.

Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act1_001_2.text: I'd trade you if I could.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act3_0.text: You say you have had many lovers, Astarion. If that is true, where are they now?

Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act3_1.text: They weren't lovers... not in the way that you mean. They wanted me more than I wanted them.

Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act3_2.text: I used that to my advantage more times than I care to remember.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act2_0.text: So Lae'zel, things seem to be getting serious with you two. Do you have pet names for each other yet?

Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_1.text: 'Pet' names? As if we were domesticated animals?

Laezel_ROM_Act2_3.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act2_3.text: Gods, you have so much to learn. Repeat after me: honey muffin, sweetie pie, sugarplum.

Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.text: Honey muffin, sweetie pie - Astarion, do you see all your lovers as food?
Laezel_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: As if they’re in another language

Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Astarion
Halsin_ROM_Act3_0.text: I hear things got wild between you two. I hope no one was too badly mauled.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_ROM_Act3_1.text: We're all in one piece. Perhaps you'll join us next time.

Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Astarion
Halsin_ROM_Act3_2.text: It's bad enough having one person with fangs trying to keep control of themselves. Two of us could be dangerous.

Laezel_BlushingMermaid_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_BlushingMermaid_0.text: Perhaps it should. All I see are carousing fools.

Laezel_BlushingMermaid_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_BlushingMermaid_1.text: I know, isn't it wonderful? Endless opportunities for mischief.

Shadowheart_Goblins_1.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Goblins_1.text: Goblins are such vile little parasites.

Shadowheart_Goblins_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Goblins_2.text: Given your own nature, are you really the one to judge?

Shadowheart_Goblins_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Goblins_0.text: Not the vilest any of us have seen of late, unfortunately.

Gale_Monastery_4.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Monastery_4.text: Another ruined temple, full of foul-smelling beasts, spoiling for a fight.

Gale_Monastery_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Monastery_0.text: No mere temple. This was a monastery, devoted as much to study as to worship.

Gale_Monastery_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Monastery_2.text: Oh, how ignorant of me. So it'll be free of foul-smelling beasts, then?
Gale_Monastery_2.context: NodeContext: He's fine with being ignorant in this case

Gale_Monastery_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Monastery_1.text: Quite the opposite. Some monastic orders celebrated their pungency as proof of their devotion. 'To think is to stink' was the motto of one ill-fated brotherhood near Amn.
Gale_Monastery_1.context: NodeContext: Not realising Astarion's question was sarcastic, enjoying flexing his knowledge.

Gale_Monastery_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_Monastery_3.text: Oh, but you meant beasts of the life-threatening variety? Yes, I'm sure it's teeming with those.
Gale_Monastery_3.context: NodeContext: Realising Astarion was taking the piss out of him, dismissively answering it

Minthara_MorphicPool_2.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_MorphicPool_2.text: We're getting close. I do believe fate is shuffling the cards for the final deal.

Minthara_MorphicPool_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_MorphicPool_0.text: Let the cards fall. We have a strong hand to play.

Minthara_MorphicPool_1.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_MorphicPool_1.text: And speaking personally, I intend to cheat.

Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_2.text: Admittedly, I don't care for most people, but this is a terrible waste.
Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_2.context: NodeContext: referring to all the wasted blood

Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_0.text: Because their lives were cut brutally short, you mean.

Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_1.text: I - ... yes, that. That's clearly what I was referring to.
Wyll_Moonrise_Oubliette_1.context: NodeContext: pretending he wasn't referring to all the wasted blood

Wyll_Wyrmway_3.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Wyrmway_3.text: I lived two centuries in this city, but it can still surprise me.

Wyll_Wyrmway_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Wyrmway_0.text: Baldur's Gate harbours many a secret. Even the longest-lived explorers have yet to uncover them all.

Wyll_Wyrmway_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Wyrmway_2.text: Speaking of - what were you getting up to all those years?

Wyll_Wyrmway_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Wyrmway_1.text: Let's not get into the details. If Baldur's Gate can have its secrets, so can I.

Shadowheart_Laezel_1.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Laezel_1.text: So, you and Lae'zel? Seems tense.

Shadowheart_Laezel_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Laezel_0.text: Please, don't remind me. But keep your guard up with her.

Laezel_Sunlight_3.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Sunlight_3.text: Do we have to spend so long poking about down here?

Laezel_Sunlight_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Sunlight_2.text: I'd much rather be outside, with the sun on my skin.

Laezel_Sunlight_4.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Sunlight_4.text: You've only just come to tolerate sun, and you're already nostalgic?

Laezel_Sunlight_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Sunlight_0.text: If you're going to complain the whole way, by all means, return topside. You could use the colour.

Gale_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.text: So, how was your night with Gale? Did you have a long, hard debate?
Gale_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: Teasing the player about spending the night with Gale

Gale_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act2_0.text: Ignore him. Astarion envies the depth of our bond because he's of a shallower inclination.

Laezel_BhaalTemple_3.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_BhaalTemple_3.text: I expected a temple to murder would be more fun. A little joyous, even.

Laezel_BhaalTemple_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_BhaalTemple_0.text: There's no greater pleasure than battle. You face your enemy and conquer them, blade to blade, spell to spell.

Laezel_BhaalTemple_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_BhaalTemple_2.text: But to take a life unawares is no more to be celebrated than plunging a dagger into a trapped rat.

Laezel_BhaalTemple_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_BhaalTemple_1.text: Oh, I don't know - I've killed plenty of rats. I celebrated every time.

Karlach_HagSwamp_3.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_HagSwamp_3.text: Transforming into a mind flayer might have its perks. At least then I could float over this muck.

Karlach_HagSwamp_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_HagSwamp_0.text: Not one for roughing it, I see.

Karlach_HagSwamp_2.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_HagSwamp_2.text: Wallowing in filth is for pigs and children, my dear.

Karlach_HagSwamp_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_HagSwamp_1.text: Pigs, children, and people with a little bit of grit.

Gale_GeneralSewers_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_GeneralSewers_2.text: I gave my return to Baldur's Gate a lot of thought. I never pictured this, though.

Gale_GeneralSewers_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_GeneralSewers_0.text: What did you have in mind? A quiet party, toasting your return with a few good friends?
Gale_GeneralSewers_0.context: NodeContext: Thinks he's knows where this is heading

Gale_GeneralSewers_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_GeneralSewers_1.text: Less 'quiet party with friends', more 'days of hedonistic debauchery'. But otherwise, yes.

Gale_GeneralSewers_3.speaker: Gale
Gale_GeneralSewers_3.text: Sounds like a recipe for disaster. But you know what? I'm learning to enjoy the taste of chaos. Count me in.
Gale_GeneralSewers_3.context: NodeContext: Relaxing a bit, not what he'd usually enjoy but trying to grow

Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_2.speaker: Astarion
Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_2.text: Cazador always warned us to stay clear of this neighbourhood. Never said why, though.

Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_0.text: The last spawn who tried was sunk into the cobblestones and left for the sun to find. I had an unfortunate taste for theatrics, in my youth.
Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_0.context: NodeContext: A little abashed, but shrugging it off

Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_1.speaker: Astarion
Jaheira_OskarsBeloved_1.text: Ah. Yes, that was probably it.

Gale_Shadowheart_Love_0.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Shadowheart_Love_0.text: So, do you have loves waiting for you once this is all over?

Gale_Shadowheart_Love_2.speaker: Gale
Gale_Shadowheart_Love_2.text: You know what - that is not the easiest of questions for me to answer.

Gale_Shadowheart_Love_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Gale_Shadowheart_Love_1.text: You mean just waiting, like a lovesick puppy? Short-term amusements are much less hassle.

Karlach_MountainPass_4.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_MountainPass_4.text: Gods, how are we not there yet? My feet are killing me.

Karlach_MountainPass_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_MountainPass_2.text: Sure! If you promise to swap once I get tired.

Karlach_MountainPass_0.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_MountainPass_0.text: Please, I can barely manage my pack - you'd kill me.

Shadowheart_Temple_0.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Temple_0.text: I do like it down here. It's nice. Homey.
Shadowheart_Temple_0.context: NodeContext: The architecture is big, sharp, grim and imposing.

Shadowheart_Temple_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Temple_2.text: This is a dedication to my goddess' power and dark beauty. Homey is not the first word that comes to mind.

Shadowheart_Temple_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Temple_1.text: This temple is positively dripping with power and dark beauty - is homey truly the first word that springs to mind?

Karlach_BaldursMouth_3.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_BaldursMouth_3.text: Probably best if I keep a low profile. They used to know me all too well in the Elfsong.

Karlach_BaldursMouth_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_BaldursMouth_0.text: Wonder if our paths ever crossed in the before-times. Were you always so sneaky?

Karlach_BaldursMouth_2.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_BaldursMouth_2.text: I haven't survived for two centuries by being reckless. And I hope to survive at least two more.

Karlach_BaldursMouth_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_BaldursMouth_1.text: Yeah yeah, don't rub it in.
Karlach_BaldursMouth_1.context: NodeContext: good natured, kinda dark humour (cause astarion's saying he could live 2 more centuries).

Minthara_ThormMausoleum_1.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ThormMausoleum_1.text: Ah, no shadow curse, plenty of funerary decor - I almost feel at home.

Minthara_ThormMausoleum_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ThormMausoleum_2.text: Stop gawking at the decor, spawn. This place is dangerous.

Minthara_ThormMausoleum_0.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ThormMausoleum_0.text: Yes, as I said - just like home.

Karlach_Forest_3.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_Forest_3.text: Biting flies, midges - shouldn't nature be beautiful and serene? It looks so nice in the Upper City parks.

Karlach_Forest_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Forest_0.text: Upper City, huh? Swish. Never spent much time there myself.

Karlach_Forest_2.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_Forest_2.text: I'll happily take you. If we survive this bugs' banquet.

Karlach_Forest_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_Forest_1.text: Sounds good. I've always been curious what a patriar loo looks like.
Karlach_Forest_1.context: NodeContext: good natured, kinda dark humour (cause astarion's saying he could live 2 more centuries).

Gale_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_ROM_Act1_2.text: So Gale, how is your sad, hopeless pining going?

Gale_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act1_1.text: I'm hardly pining. It's been a year or more since Mystra cast me aside.

Gale_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Astarion
Gale_ROM_Act1_0.text: Oh, my dear wizard. I wasn't talking about Mystra.

Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_2.text: Gods, whoever thought I'd be happy to see the Flaming Fist?

Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_0.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_0.text: Being in a land of cursed, angry shadows, you start to see things in a new light.

Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_LastLight_Protected_1.text: Admit it - you're just glad to see some potential meals walking about after all those bloodless shadows.

Wyll_Forest_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Forest_2.text: Well, it's no Baldur's Gate, but at least it's some kind of civilisation.

Wyll_Forest_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Forest_0.text: I do miss the Gate, though. The Elfsong Tavern! Sunset over Grey Harbour! Fried fish at the docks!

Wyll_Forest_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Forest_1.text: Drunk young patriars, naked in the fountains! Ah, civilisation...

Minthara_WyrmsRock_1.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_WyrmsRock_1.text: So many dark nooks and crannies - this fortress is a lurker's paradise.

Minthara_WyrmsRock_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_WyrmsRock_0.text: Would you not prefer basking in the sun like a lizard now that it no longer blisters your pretty skin?
Minthara_WyrmsRock_0.context: NodeContext: gently mocking Astarion, who still seems to enjoy being in the darkness

Minthara_WyrmsRock_2.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_WyrmsRock_2.text: Old habits die hard, darling. Surely you know that.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act1_1.text: Would you believe, I've never been with a githyanki.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ROM_Act1_2.text: If you cease your frivolous ways, keep your mouth closed, and learn to obey, perhaps we can attempt it.

Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ROM_Act1_0.text: Haha! No, I think I will leave that honour to our esteemed friend.

Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_2.text: The boat's heading to Baldur's Gate. I'm almost tempted to stow away.

Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_0.text: Chk. Try to abandon us and it won't go well for you.

Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Moonrise_Docs_1.text: Oh, I wouldn't actually leave. After all, where would you be without me?

Gale_Bomb_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Bomb_2.text: That orb seems powerful. What can it do once it's extracted?

Gale_Bomb_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Bomb_1.text: Nothing good can come of it unless it is contained. Why?

Gale_Bomb_0.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Bomb_0.text: It might be useful. Who knows?

Minthara_Bonecloaks_1.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_Bonecloaks_1.text: No, this place feels all too 'Underdark'y for me.

Minthara_Bonecloaks_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Bonecloaks_2.text: You are speaking of my home, spawn. It is pleasant to be reminded of it.

Minthara_Bonecloaks_3.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_Bonecloaks_3.text: Oh dear - you're not going to come over all pleasant and homely, are you?

Minthara_Bonecloaks_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_Bonecloaks_0.context: NodeContext: responding to Astarion who hasked her if she's feeling friendlier than usual - she's mocking, not being too cruel

Gale_Moonrise_General_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Moonrise_General_2.text: Can't say I love what they've done with the place.

Gale_Moonrise_General_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Moonrise_General_0.text: Unsurprising, really. Fanatical cultists tend to care more for ambience than aesthetics.
Gale_Moonrise_General_0.context: NodeContext: A subject he feels he knows a little about. 'Ambience' Implication being cultists are more focused on inspiring fear/awe/dread than making the palce look nice.

Gale_Moonrise_General_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Moonrise_General_1.text: Reason enough to put them all to the sword, I say.

Gale_Flirt_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Flirt_1.text: I am enjoying our walks together, aren't you, Gale?

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_1.text: Living without sunlight isn't so bad, Astarion. Where I came from, we would often work exclusively under cover of darkness.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_2.text: Yes, but you chose darkness. I was cast into it.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_0.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act2_Sunlight_0.text: The sun was banished from my life - forbidden. And we all lust after the forbidden, don't we?

Wyll_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act2_1.text: I'm surprised I never saw you lurking in the shadows at any Baldurian balls, Astarion.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act2_2.text: The city's elite was not my target audience, alas.

Wyll_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act2_0.text: People ask questions when members of the nobility disappear, and the last thing Cazador wanted was people asking questions.

Wyll_BloomridgePark_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_BloomridgePark_2.text: You know, I've never seen this place in the daylight before.

Wyll_BloomridgePark_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_BloomridgePark_0.text: I always loved this park. Spent a lot of time here as a boy battling imaginary monsters.

Wyll_BloomridgePark_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_BloomridgePark_1.text: Oh, I was going to say it looks wretched. The dark hid all the kitschy details.

Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ROM_Act2_0.text: So how does Lolth feel about romance? Are you expected to bite your mate's head off afterwards?

Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.text: Be grateful I no longer follow the Spider Queen's teachings. If I did, you would be the first to fall into my web.
Minthara_ROM_Act2_1.context: NodeContext: teasing Astarion with a grotesquely exaggerated version of how she would seduce him

Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.text: I can't tell if you're joking. She is joking, right?
Minthara_ROM_Act2_2.context: NodeContext: first phrase to Minthara, then appealing to the party at large for support

Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_3.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_3.text: It's a long time since I was in a house of healing. Gods, it's depressing.

Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_0.text: I suppose you don't have much use for hospitals... unless you're seeking to steal their blood stock.

Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_2.text: True, although I don't heal as fast as I used to. The one downside to the tadpole, I suppose.

Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_HouseOfHealing_1.text: The one downside? I think you might have stopped the count too soon...

Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_1.text: Moonlanterns to keep the curse back, burly guards to fight off any monsters - I could get used to this place.

Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_0.text: Don't get too comfortable. We shouldn't overstay our welcome in such a place.
Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_0.context: NodeContext: Serious, bringing Astarion back down to earth

Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Moonrise_BridgeFirstTime_2.text: No, of course. Why stay somewhere safe and comfortable when we could be in mortal peril?

Gale_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_ROM_Act3_1.text: So, Gale - you laid with a goddess? You must have some sordid tales to tell?

Gale_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_ROM_Act3_0.text: Sordid? I lay with the Mother of Magic herself. What we had was transcendent, euphoric, incandescent. Not sordid.

Gale_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_ROM_Act3_2.text: You actually made sleeping with a goddess sound boring. Incredible...

Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_2.text: Gods - we're not back, are we?

Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_0.text: On the nautiloid? No, this is a different nursery - similar, but not identical. There's likely one in every colony.
Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_0.context: NodeContext: Fascinated by what he's seeing

Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Colony_TadpolingCentre_1.text: I don't care what's in every mind flayer colony, Gale - nobody does. Except you.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_2.text: I'm probably more at home in the water than you now, Astarion.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_0.text: Probably. Although I am two hundred years out of practice. Running water is no place for vampires.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act3_Selune_1.text: But perhaps I'll join you for a dip once everything is done. Then we could see who's best.

Laezel_SharTemple_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_SharTemple_2.text: It's all very grand, but so austere.

Laezel_SharTemple_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_SharTemple_0.text: Did you expect anything else? This is how your gods project power.

Laezel_SharTemple_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_SharTemple_1.text: But why not project power with soft furnishings and roaring fires? Maybe then I'd worship them.

Wyll_RoadToSCL_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_RoadToSCL_2.text: I used to be agog at everything when I first walked in the sun. Perhaps I'm adjusting to this new life.

Wyll_RoadToSCL_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_RoadToSCL_0.text: It's when you use words like 'agog' that I remember you're actually two centuries old.

Wyll_RoadToSCL_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_RoadToSCL_1.text: And it's when you think 'agog' is an impressive word that I remember you're just a child.

Gale_Colony_Generall_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Colony_Generall_2.text: It's enough to put you off tentacles for life.

Gale_Colony_Generall_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_Colony_Generall_0.text: You had a taste for tentacles?

Gale_Colony_Generall_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Colony_Generall_1.text: The Elfsong Tavern used to serve excellent calamari. Mind you, that was two hundred years ago...

Laezel_ReithwinVillage_5.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ReithwinVillage_5.text: Just once, I'd like to find a village that hasn't been plundered and destroyed.

Laezel_ReithwinVillage_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ReithwinVillage_2.text: Indeed. All the best weapons have already been scavenged.

Laezel_ReithwinVillage_4.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_ReithwinVillage_4.text: I was thinking about a warm fire and charming company, actually.

Laezel_ReithwinVillage_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_ReithwinVillage_3.text: I am perfectly charming, I'll have you know. On Crèche K'liir, I was known for my dazzling smile and charisma.

Gale_Illusion_0.speaker: Astarion
Gale_Illusion_0.text: From sweet woodland to stinking swamp. Can you do tricks like that, Gale?

Gale_Illusion_1.speaker: Gale
Gale_Illusion_1.text: Easiest thing in the world. Though I'd do it the other way around.

Jaheira_BaldursGate_2.speaker: Astarion
Jaheira_BaldursGate_2.text: Beyond that gate is the Upper City, housing the great and the good of Baldur's Gate.

Jaheira_BaldursGate_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_BaldursGate_0.text: You yearn for a better class of company, Astarion?
Jaheira_BaldursGate_0.context: NodeContext: Dry, 'are we peasants not good enough'

Jaheira_BaldursGate_1.speaker: Astarion
Jaheira_BaldursGate_1.text: Gods no - who'd want to spend time with anyone great or good?

Shadowheart_Guildhall_3.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Guildhall_3.text: Well, well. The fabled haunt of Nine-Fingers Keene.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Guildhall_0.text: Never visited before? I thought you got around.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Guildhall_2.text: I always steered clear. If Guild members started disappearing, people would start asking questions. And Cazador hated questions.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Guildhall_1.text: Understandable, when the answer is invariably 'the silver-haired one ate them'.

Wyll_Underdark_1.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Underdark_1.text: Spent much time in the Underdark?

Wyll_Underdark_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Underdark_3.text: I've slayed a death dog or six, crossed a few duergar.

Wyll_Underdark_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Underdark_0.text: I never was scared of the shadows.

Wyll_Underdark_4.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Underdark_4.text: Some. And you? Seems a perfect hunting ground for... you know.

Wyll_Underdark_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Underdark_2.text: Perfect? You try drinking an earth elemental's blood.

Laezel_Brewery_3.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Brewery_3.text: Ah, beer. Not really my drink, you know.

Laezel_Brewery_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Brewery_0.text: I know, Astarion. You prefer blood.

Laezel_Brewery_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Brewery_2.text: Well - yes. It was a joke.

Laezel_Brewery_1.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Brewery_1.text: I know that, too. It just wasn't funny.

Gale_RebelHideout_2.speaker: Astarion
Gale_RebelHideout_2.text: What's this? A clever little hideaway?

Gale_RebelHideout_0.speaker: Gale
Gale_RebelHideout_0.text: Not just clever - rather ingenious. Somehow its construction keeps the Shadow Curse at bay.

Gale_RebelHideout_1.speaker: Astarion
Gale_RebelHideout_1.text: A little too clever, if you ask me. Watch out for traps.

Wyll_Gale_Cazador_0.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Gale_Cazador_0.text: Ever heard of a vampire called Cazador, Wyll?

Wyll_Gale_Cazador_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Gale_Cazador_2.text: I don't think so. Why? Friend of yours?

Wyll_Gale_Cazador_4.speaker: Gale
Wyll_Gale_Cazador_4.text: He's patriarch of the Szarr family. Nasty fellow, if the histories are accurate.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_1.text: Do vampires actually usually drink blood out of goblets like in the storybooks? Doesn't seem very fresh.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_3.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_3.text: Straight from the neck is preferred, but goblets are used in mortal company. They save on awkwardness.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_0.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_0.text: We could share a drink some night, if you're curious. A nice red wine in your goblet, of course.

Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_ROM_Act1_Wine_2.text: Very kind of you, but I'm saving my best bottle for someone already.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ROM_Act3_1.text: So, what's it like caring for someone other than yourself, Minthara?

Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_2.text: You have never tried it, I assume.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Astarion
Minthara_ROM_Act3_3.text: Gods no. It sounds like a lot of work.

Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Minthara_ROM_Act3_0.text: It takes less work than you devote to maintaining your foppish facade. And it's far more rewarding.

Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_2.text: These woods feel unsettling - like they're dangling on the edge between life and death.

Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_0.text: Isn't that how you feel all the time, Astarion? I thought you'd find it comforting.

Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_1.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_SCL_Forest_1.context: NodeContext: Astarion does not, in fact, find this very funny.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act3_2.text: Marriage, Wyll? I thought you'd have learned not to get trapped by devious contracts.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_ROM_Act3_1.text: I was planning to invite you to the ceremony, but I'm having second thoughts.

Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_ROM_Act3_0.text: I'd love to come! As long as I can sit with someone fun. Mizora, perhaps?

Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_3.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_3.text: The graveyard's ancient, but the graves are fresh.

Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_2.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_2.text: I haven't set foot in a graveyard since I became a spawn, thank you. Vampires are nothing like those other undead.

Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_LastLight_Graveyard_1.text: True. I've never heard a mummy complain about a wrinkled doublet. Or sour wine.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_0.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act2_0.text: So the more you cool down, the more your love life heats up?

Karlach_ROM_Act2_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act2_2.text: Seems that way! But I'm a bit out of practice, to be honest.

Karlach_ROM_Act2_1.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act2_1.text: I'm sure it'll all come back to you. You'll be as depraved as the rest of us in no time.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_3.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_3.text: What a delightfully secluded alley. I would have been in my element here, once.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_0.text: But you consort with a better class of people now, right?

Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_2.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_2.text: A different class of person. And a different type of consorting.

Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Guildhall_Entrance_1.text: Let's just stop this conversation right here, shall we?

Laezel_Lore_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Lore_2.text: So, you know about these parasites. Will we survive them?

Laezel_Lore_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Lore_0.text: Only if my people extract them. The only other cure is the blade.

Laezel_Lore_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Lore_1.context: NodeContext: Resigned, said with a sigh.

Laezel_Combat_2.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Combat_2.text: You fight well, but you're so efficient. Why not have a little fun?

Laezel_Combat_0.speaker: Lae'zel
Laezel_Combat_0.text: Fun? I fight to win, not to make spectacles.

Laezel_Combat_1.speaker: Astarion
Laezel_Combat_1.context: NodeContext: Throw in a "pfft" or "huh" before 'what a waste'. Something a little derisive.

Wyll_Vampire_5.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Vampire_5.text: A question for our master monster hunter: how would you approach killing a vampire?

Wyll_Vampire_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Vampire_3.text: A full-on vamp, you mean? Lure it into the sun, drive a stake through its heart.

Wyll_Vampire_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Vampire_0.text: And that's not the end of it. The suckers are wily. No offence.

Wyll_Vampire_4.speaker: Astarion
Wyll_Vampire_4.text: None taken. Wiliness keeps me alive. More or less.

Wyll_Vampire_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_Vampire_1.text: To start? Lure it into the sun, drive a stake through its heart. Why?

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_4.speaker: Astarion
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_4.text: Shadowheart. Such a grim name for such a beautiful flower.

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_0.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_0.text: Could you not stare so blatantly at my neck when you say that please?
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_0.context: NodeContext: Response to flirtation from Astarion. She's aware he's a vampire.

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_2.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_2.text: Oh, but do keep calling her 'flower'. She'll love that.

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_1.speaker: Shadowheart
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_1.text: I heard you mumbling that line to yourself earlier - it needs more work.
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_1.context: NodeContext: Response to flirtation from Astarion.

Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_3.speaker: Lae'zel
Shadowheart_Laezel_Flirt_3.text: Fortunate for his tongue he didn't say it to me.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act3_3.text: I hear you were spotted being 'normal' in the Singing Lute, Karlach. Are you feeling all right?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_1.text: Seemed like the right thing to do. I've never really tried 'normal' before.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_5.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act3_5.text: And? How did you find the quiet life?

Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_2.text: It was nice. It was really nice.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_4.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_ROM_Act3_4.text: I never thought I'd see the day - our champion of the Hells has gone soft.

Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_ROM_Act3_0.context: NodeContext: with relief, reflecting on the fact that someone said she's 'gone soft,' which for her would be a luxury
